Title:
Curvicladiella paphiopedili sp. nov., a new species on orchid
(Paphiopedilum sp.) from Guizhou, China
Abstract:
An asexual fungus was collected from diseased leaves of
Paphiopedilum sp. from Guizhou Province, China. Its morphologies were
characterized by penicillate conidiophores with a stipe, dull, tapering
towards the apex and the curved stipe extension, cylindrical conidia. In
the phylogenetic analyses of combined LSU, cmdA, his3, ITS, tef1 and
tub2 sequence data, this taxon was clustered as sister to Curvicladiella
cignea within Nectriaceae. Based on the morphological characters and
phylogenetic analyses, Curvicladiella paphiopedili sp. nov. was
introduced and illustrated with discussion of its phylogenetic
placement.
